concept.title: Using Sort to Find a Specific Report Attribute

conbody.p: You can specify any of the label icons circled as shown in Figure 2-14 below to sort all reports by a specific report attribute. This allows you to find reports by attributes that cannot be filtered.
The following is a description (from left to right) of each available sort attribute:

row.entry: Either Wizard report or SQL Workbench Reports
Wizard reports that have aggregation are indicated with a checkmark.
Wizard reports that have the time range limit set to a field of type datetime. Hover the mouse over the clock icon to see the name of the field that is set in the report definition.

An integer count of the number of fields used as filters in the report definition. If any of the filters are required for entry at report run time, the color of the integer is teal-green. Hovering the mouse over the clock icon will display the list of filters.
Reports that have models connected to this report that are automatically run after the report runs and which process the report results.
Reports that have charts configured for the report. Hover the mouse over this icon to display the chart type.
An integer count of the number of drill-downs configured to associated reports for each report. Hover the mouse over the icon to display the names of the associated reports.
The date and time the report was last updated.
The number of report versions within the reportâ€™s history retention period.
The size of the report in megabytes.
Report tags (categories) under which the report is categorized.
